intro: Macleania kalbreyeri, commonly known as the Kalbreyer's mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Onocleaceae and is characterized by its succulent, evergreen leaves and small, white or yellowish flowers. The plant attaches itself to the branches of host trees, drawing water and nutrients through its haustoria. It produces small, fleshy berries that are often consumed by birds, aiding in seed dispersal. Due to its specialized growth habits and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
